title: Tiohtià:ke Strike
subtitle: We're building power together. Join us in the fight for housing that's affordable, dignified, and controlled by our communities - not landlords.
whoAreWePara1: We're tenants, organizers, and neighbors in Tiohtià:ke (Montreal). We believe housing is a right - not something to profit from.
whoAreWePara2: We've all felt it: rents going up, conditions getting worse, our rights ignored. But we're not alone. Together, we're building real power. Block by block. Building by building.
whyRentStrikePara1: When landlords won't listen, we act together. A rent strike gives us real power to demand what we deserve: safe homes, fair rents, and respect.
whyRentStrikeList1: Rents that keep rising while wages don't
whyRentStrikeList3: Landlords who ignore repairs and our rights
whyRentStrikeList4: A system that always sides with property owners
whyRentStrikeList5: Corporate landlords treating our homes like investments
whyRentStrikePara3: We're done accepting this. A rent strike isn't just about money - it's about power. When we organize together, we win. We've seen it work. You can too.
whyCoopsPara1: Imagine owning your home with your neighbors. Making decisions together. No landlord. No rent hikes. That's a housing co-op.
whyCoopsList1: Homes we can actually afford - permanently
whyCoopsList2: Real control over where we live
whyCoopsList3: Communities that can't be sold out from under us
whyCoopsList4: A model that's worked for decades - right here in Quebec
whyCoopsPara3: We want co-ops everywhere. When we convert buildings to co-ops, we take them off the market for good. No more speculation. No more displacement. Just homes that belong to the people who live in them. That's the Tiohtià:ke we're building.

artworkInfo: (1893–95). This pointillist painting represents an idealized society by the seashore where people perform various activities in harmony. Originally titled "In the Time of Anarchy," it was created during Signac's engagement with socialism and anarchist politics, envisioning a utopian future where work, family, and play exist harmoniously.
